intro: Mentzelia longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its slender stems and showy yellow to orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia longiloba is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
